Author: brett
Title: RFaceBook: Ruby library for FaceBook's new API

Author: danteembermage
Content:
Make a somewhat effusive statement, that's really ingenious; a hard currency for the new millenium, portable, divisible, and universally accepted.

Of course you've traded the brutal master of the despot's printing press for the harsh mistress of Moore's law, but the second at least is somewhat predictable.

Author: bootload
Title: "The Innovator's Solution" & interpretations as it relates to web development

Author: amichail
Title: How important is a founder's personality as it relates to the target demographic?

Author: natrius
Content:
Pretty much any service has these same terms. What do you expect them to do? Promise to not do anything similar to any app people happen to build? Promise to provide free access forever? No responsible business would do that.

Any time you're building your business on top of something that isn't in your control, you should be cautious. This isn't any different.
